definition[0]: refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion
example[0]: the ruthless suppression of political dissent
example[1]: These voices of dissent grew louder.
definition[1]: a statement by a judge giving their reasons for disagreeing with the other judges in a law case
definition[2]: to say that you disagree with an official decision or accepted opinion
example[2]: There are some dissenting voices  (=people who do not agree) among the undergraduates.
example[3]: Few historians would dissent from this view.
definition[3]: if a judge dissents, they say formally that they do not agree with the other judges in a law case
